thread.title: No. 1 Kansas rallies to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Senior Night
thread.title_full: No. 1 Kansas rallies to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Senior Night

author: AP
title: No. 1 Kansas rallies to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Senior Night
text:
No. 1 Kansas rallies to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Senior Night Frank Mason III scored 23 points in his final game at Allen Fieldhouse, Devonte Graham hit a series of crucial 3-pointers in the second half and top-ranked Kansas rallied from a 10-point deficit to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Monday night Post to Facebook No. 1 Kansas rallies to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Senior Night Frank Mason III scored 23 points in his final game at Allen Fieldhouse, Devonte Graham hit a series of crucial 3-pointers in the second half and top-ranked Kansas rallied from a 10-point deficit to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Monday night  //usat.ly/2lOscrQ   Join the Nation's Conversation   No. 1 Kansas rallies to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Senior Night AP 11:27 p.m. ET Feb. 27, 2017 Kansas head coach Bill Self applauds his seniors before an NCAA college basketball game against Oklahoma in Lawrence, Kan., Monday, Feb. 27, 2017. (AP Photo/Orlin Wagner) (Photo: The Associated Press) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LAWRENCE, Kan. (AP) — Frank Mason III scored 23 points in his final game at Allen Fieldhouse, Devonte Graham hit a series of crucial 3-pointers in the second half and top-ranked Kansas rallied from a 10-point deficit to beat Oklahoma 73-63 on Monday night. 
Graham finished with 16 points and Josh Jackson had 11 points and 12 rebounds for the Big 12 champion Jayhawks (27-3, 15-2), who trailed 54-42 before finishing the game on a 31-11 run. 
The Sooners (10-19, 4-13) were poised to spring a big upset on the day the Jayhawks ascended to No. 1 for the first time this season. But after they took their biggest lead with just over 10 minutes to go, Mason got the comeback started with a nifty basket inside. 
He added a steal moments later to set up Lagerald Vick's 3-pointer, and Jackson scored before Graham hit back-to-back shots from beyond the arc. And when Mason added another basket moments later, the Jayhawks had put together a 17-2 charge that gave them a 64-58 lead with about 5 minutes left. 
Kansas slowly drew away to make senior night memorable for Mason, big man Landen Lucas and reserve guard Tyler Self, whose father — Kansas coach Bill Self — called him "my favorite Jayhawk of all time."
